attributes.action: Ford, should review security issues with keyless entry. Treat as warranty issue
attributes.additional_details:
Two Ford Kugas (one owned personally) were taken in one area of Coventry within 15 minutes apart. Both cars were locked and both were  easily taken within 60 secs. The number of Fords stolen compared with other brands is significantly larger. The rate of increase is also worrying – there were over five times more Fords stolen in the first half of this year, compared with the same time period in 2015.

Read more: https://www.which.co.uk/news/2018/07/cars-brands-most-likely-to-be-stolen/ - Which?
attributes.background: With keyless entry car theft on the rise I think it is time the manufacturers were held accountable for a clearly inadequate software/system which is so easily overridden. It should be dealt with as a failure in their software and therefore a warranty issue regarding the production of the vehicles.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Ford is a private company and the UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for their decisions.

You may wish to contact them directly about this issue.
